about.description: eLink strategically targets the commanding heights of future technology and industrial development, including Artificial Intelligence (AI), the Metaverse, Blockchain, Edge Computing, and 5G/6G. We gather experts in fields such as AI and blockchain from domestic and international institutions of higher learning and scientific research organizations. It combines their expertise with the years of practical experience from technology enterprises in commercial informatization and digital intelligence.
about.summary: eLink targets the commanding heights of future tech like AI, Metaverse, and 6G. Through the 'Cross-border E-commerce Committee', we act as a bridge, organizing experts to tackle core technical challenges and accelerate the fusion of AI with the digital commerce ecosystem.

goals.title: Our Three Major Goals
goals.goal1: To cultivate students' interest in science, making them scientifically literate and laying a solid foundation for future development.
goals.goal2: To learn cutting-edge skills like programming and AI, keeping pace with 21st-century tech and preparing for the future workplace.
goals.goal3: To prepare for science and innovation competitions by applying learned skills to practical scenarios, enhancing comprehensive abilities and competitiveness.

about.title: About the Journal
about.desc: Co-founded with leading academic institutions, JEBDE is a peer-reviewed journal dedicated to advancing research and practice in the fields of electronic business and the digital economy. It serves as a premier platform for academics, researchers, and industry professionals to share innovative ideas and impactful findings.

collaborativeProject.title: Government, Industry, Academia & Research Collaborative Projects

item1.title: Research on Passenger Growth Forecasting Models
item1.desc: Analyzing complex passenger traffic data and various influencing factors to provide crucial data support for strategic planning, operational adjustments, and efficient resource allocation.

item2.title: Research on Tenant Renewal Rate Analysis Models
item2.desc: Developing predictive models to analyze tenant renewal rates, identifying key factors to provide businesses with data-driven insights for decision-making and improved tenant retention.

item3.title: Research on Optimal Big Data Architecture
item3.desc: Focusing on building scalable, efficient, and reliable big data architectures to replace traditional systems in large-scale, high-concurrency data environments.

caseStudy.title: O2O Consumer Behavior Analytics
caseStudy.desc: In partnership with a major retail group, we conducted in-depth research on consumer behavior in large-scale shopping malls, leveraging data to bridge the online-to-offline gap. Key outcomes included:
caseStudy.point1: Developed a predictive model for foot traffic and purchasing patterns.
caseStudy.point2: Identified key drivers for repeat visits and customer loyalty.
caseStudy.point3: Provided actionable recommendations for personalized marketing campaigns.

cta.title: Have a Research Challenge?
cta.desc: Let's collaborate to turn your complex industry problems into data-driven solutions and innovative breakthroughs.

hero.title: Don't Let Your Child Become an I-Shaped Specialist.
hero.subtitle: A STEAM Education Guide for Parents on the Path to Becoming a T-Shaped Generalist.

intro.p1: When AlphaGo defeated the world champion, and AI art won top awards, a wave of anxiety swept through parenting circles: Does my child have to learn programming? Do they need to understand AI? The answer is yes, but that's far from the whole story.
intro.p2: The true goal of STEAM education has never been to train programmers or AI engineers, but to cultivate 'T-shaped changemakers' who can master technology to solve unknown problems.

part1.title: The Future is Calling: Goodbye I-Talent, Hello T-Talent

iTalent.title: The I-Shaped Talent
iTalent.desc: Possesses deep expertise in a specific field, like the letter 'I'. In an era of rapid technological iteration, the protective moat of a single skill is becoming increasingly fragile.

tTalent.title: The T-Shaped Talent
tTalent.desc: Not only has the vertical depth of expertise but also the horizontal breadth—encompassing cross-disciplinary knowledge, empathy, collaboration, and a holistic perspective. This is the talent the future truly needs.

wefSkills.title: Top 10 Fastest-Growing Skills by 2030
wefSkills.subtitle: According to the World Economic Forum's 'Future of Jobs Report'

part2.title: Part 2: The Developmental Blueprint
part2.subtitle: How can we cultivate such 'T-shaped' talent? The answer: follow their natural development. We must align innovation education with a 'developmental guide' based on established psychological principles.

stage1.title: Stage 1 (Ages 4-7): Hands-On Exploration, Sowing the Seeds of Curiosity
stage1.perspectiveDesc: Children at this age are in Piaget's 'Preoperational Stage', understanding the world through senses and concrete actions. They are also in Erikson's 'Initiative vs. Guilt' phase, filled with a desire to explore and an infinite imagination.
stage1.focusDesc: Play-based Learning. The goal is to protect and stimulate curiosity. Education should provide a rich, safe environment for them to build a basic understanding of the physical world through touch, observation, and feeling.

s.desc: Sensory exploration: playing with water, sand, observing plant growth.

t.desc: Unplugged programming through physical command card games.

e.desc: Free construction with building blocks and LEGOs.

a.desc: Free creation and self-expression through art.

m.desc: Pattern recognition through classifying and tidying up.

stage2.title: Stage 2 (Ages 7-12): Constructing Logic, a Bridge from Concrete to Abstract
stage2.psychology: Concrete Operational Stage | Industry vs. Inferiority
stage2.perspectiveDesc: Children enter Piaget's 'Concrete Operational Stage,' where logical thinking emerges but still relies on concrete objects. In Erikson's 'Industry vs. Inferiority' phase, they are driven to gain a sense of accomplishment by mastering new skills.
stage2.focusDesc: Project-Based Learning (PBL). This is the golden period to combine logical thinking with hands-on ability. The goal is to guide them to use technology to solve tangible problems, giving them a real sense of competence.

sm.desc: Conduct controlled experiments and learn to record and present data using charts.

t.desc: Introduce graphical programming like Scratch, which turns abstract commands into draggable, colorful blocks.

e.desc: Tackle design challenges and experience the engineering cycle: define, ideate, prototype, test, and refine.

a.desc: Combine coding and AI with art to create interactive digital art installations.

stage3.title: Stage 3 (Ages 12-18): Abstract Thinking, Exploring Infinite Possibilities
stage3.psychology: Formal Operational Stage | Identity vs. Role Confusion
stage3.perspectiveDesc: Teenagers reach Piaget's 'Formal Operational Stage,' gaining the ability for abstract thought and hypothetical reasoning. They face Erikson's core task of 'Identity vs. Role Confusion'—answering the question, 'Who am I?'
stage3.focusDesc: Real-World Problem Solving. The objective is to encourage teens to use their maturing cognitive and technical skills to investigate real social issues, explore personal interests, and thereby build a solid self-identity.

sm.desc: Move from classroom experiments to real-world inquiry. Use languages like Python to analyze public data and discover insights.

t.desc: Transition from graphical to text-based programming (e.g., Python) to solve more complex problems.

e.desc: Engage in social innovation design. Address community issues like recycling or elderly care by designing a feasible prototype solution.

a.desc: Participate in robotics competitions, hackathons, or science fairs to fuse all STEAM elements and test core skills like teamwork and project management.

conclusion.title: Invest in Your Child's Future: Choose the Complete 'T'
conclusion.p1: In this era of change, don't settle for equipping them with a single, seemingly popular 'I-shaped' skill. Choose an educational model that nurtures their nature, fosters cross-disciplinary integration, and encourages lifelong learning.
conclusion.p2: Because we are not just cultivating engineers who can execute commands, but leaders who can define the future and create value.

hero.alt: Journey Beyond the Stars: Astronomer Experience
hero.subTitle: Astronomer Experience
hero.desc: Exploring the mysteries of the cosmos through professional observation and aerospace science.

activity1.name: Astrological prediction
activity1.desc: This is an experiential astronomy activity specifically designed for primary and secondary school students and members of the public interested in astronomy. The activities include explanations of astronomical science, immersive experiences in a mobile planetarium, and hands-on stargazing with a dedicated astronomical telescope, aiming to promote public interest in astronomy.

activity2.name: Stargazing Experience Camp
activity2.desc: This 2-day, 1-night experiential camp, organized by Elink Innovation Technology, focuses on astronomy. STEAM or other science themes can also be incorporated to align with school/institution plans. Please contact us for more information.

activity3.name: RGB Workshop
activity3.desc: This course introduces the relevant knowledge and challenges required for actual astronomical observation and research. Through this course, students will have the opportunity to try creating RGB images of different celestial objects and experience the daily research work of astronomers.

activity4.name: Activities
activity4.desc: Past have a lot of activities

keyLearning.title: Key Learning
keyLearning.desc: Understanding the Solar System, Constellation Identification, and Telescope Optics.

handsOnExperience.title: Hands-on Experience
handsOnExperience.desc: Hands-on stargazing sessions and virtual planetarium tours.

nightSkyObservation.title: Night Sky Observation
nightSkyObservation.desc: Real-time tracking of celestial bodies with professional guidance.

spaceTechnology.title: Space Technology
spaceTechnology.desc: Learning about rockets, satellites, and the International Space Station (ISS).

astrophysicsLite.title: Astrophysics Lite
astrophysicsLite.desc: Simplified concepts of gravity, light years, and planetary motion.

impact.title: Global Perspective & Career Readiness
impact.desc: This program fosters a global perspective by connecting students to the universal language of astronomy, while igniting long-term interest in aerospace careers. Participants develop critical thinking, patience, and a sense of wonder about the natural world—skills that transcend the classroom and prepare them for future STEM opportunities.

finalCta.title: Bring the Universe to Your School
finalCta.desc: Our Astronomer Experience program is designed to be flexible for school groups of all sizes. From half-day workshops to full-day immersive experiences, we tailor the curriculum to match your educational goals and student age groups.

hero.desc: Empowering the next generation of innovators through hands-on STEAM exploration.

overview.desc: Our "Future Scientist" philosophy moves beyond passive learning to active scientific inquiry—empowering students to ask questions, design experiments, and discover answers through hands-on exploration.

criticalThinking.title: Critical Thinking

collaboration.title: Collaboration

appliedPhysics.title: Applied Physics

biologicalInquiry.title: Biological Inquiry
biologicalInquiry.desc: Study living organisms and their interactions with the environment.

sustainableTech.title: Sustainable Tech

primary.title: Primary School Students

secondary.title: Secondary School Students

hero.desc: Mastery of Python, AI applications, and hardware integration for the leaders of tomorrow.

training.title: Intensive Training & Coaching
training.intro: Our training program combines technical skill-building with competition strategy to ensure participants are fully prepared for the global stage. We offer:
training.point1: 8-week intensive technical training led by industry experts
training.point2: Mock competitions with real-time feedback and improvement plans
training.point3: One-on-one coaching for presentation and technical interview skills
training.point4: Access to state-of-the-art robotics and AI equipment for practice
training.point5: Mental preparation and stress management for high-pressure competition environments

exchange.valueDesc: Our exchange programs foster cross-cultural collaboration, provide networking opportunities with global tech experts, and broaden students' horizons beyond technical skills – preparing them to be global citizens and future leaders in technology.

siliconValley.highlight: Tech company visits and startup mentorship

boston.highlight: Ivy League university workshops and lab tours

singapore.highlight: Asian tech hub collaboration and innovation labs

emma.quote: This program gave me the confidence to compete on the global stage and connect with like-minded innovators.

alex.quote: The intensive training prepared me not just for the competition, but for future STEM careers.

teamHorizon.quote: Cross-cultural collaboration was the key to our success – we learned as much from others as we taught.

finalCta.title: Is your school ready to compete globally?
finalCta.desc: Partner with us to bring world-class competition training and international exposure to your students. Our tailored programs adapt to your school's needs and goals, ensuring maximum impact for your students.
